Summary: My husband and I have booked this hotel 2 times. It is so close to Disneyland, and it’s an AMAZING price. We came in February too and they had just finished renovating, so the rooms are clean and updated. The customer service here is great as well. Parking is right outside our room, and they have a vending machine stocked with the best snacks. We recommend it to all of our friends, and family. We already booked here for our next trip too. So if your looking for something inexpensive, and close to Disneyland this is the place!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for your review and recommendation! We are delighted to hear that you and your husband were satisfied with your stay at our hotel. Your feedback is very valuable to us and we're thrilled that you had a great experience with our newly renovated rooms and excellent customer service. We are also glad that you found our location to be convenient for your Disneyland trips and that you found our vending machine well-stocked with your favorite snacks. We look forward to having you back again soon!  Sincerely Hotel Manager

Summary: Very Bad Experience.  Grounds were overgrown and dirty.  Room was clean but tiny, but the related services (soaps, kleenex, hair dryer) were horrible.  One of the tackiest places I've ever stayed, and will never stay there again.

The overall conditions of the place are bad, needs serious maintenance and cleaning. The bathtub was dirty, there was no lock on the door, the air conditioning malfunctioned. Also, before making the reservation, I’d called (and they take a looooong time to answer) before and asked if we could early check in at 11. They said yes; when the day came, they wouldn’t let us check in at the agreed time… do not book here

Save your money. This was the dirtiest place I've ever stayed. There were cigarette burns in the bedding, the door lock to our room was broken, the room smelled, and just made you feel dirty bring in there. There are many homeless people hanging around the property and we were approached by them a few times asking for cigarettes or hand outs.

Summary Heading: Good but front man was rude
Summary: House keeper was extremely nice and helpful, she asked if anything was needed and made sure that we had everything to our liking and just held a nice conversation. but the front desk man was rude. He did not want to answer any questions I had, or inform on anything.  She made up for his poor customer service.

Summary Heading: Awful, disgusting, roach infested drug house
Summary: Stay away from this place!! I had to sleep in my clothes and still woke up to roaches crawling on the bed despite leaving the lights on. I found a used needle in one of the drawers and both of the security locks had been busted off the back of the door as if the room had been raided.

Extremely dirty!!! Stains on the walls,  dirty bathroom to the point that you would not want to take shower. Urine stains on the bathroom walls and floor. The TV remote was covered in oil and chips. The beds were dirty and very uncomfortable.

Filthy roach-infested hotel.  Dirty sheets, floors, and furnishings.  Very poorly maintained.  Thrift store furnishings and artwork.  We observed Fullerton PD cruise the parking lot four times within an hour or two. We talked with one carload (4 officers in "Gang Task Force" uniforms), and they informed us that this property is a drug hot-spot. This seems logical, as it appeared that many "guests" were actually residents.  Management appears to drive high end Mercedes and BMWs. They should spend some of the money on the property!

Summary Heading: This is not a great choice of a hotel, other than it's vicinity to Disneyland.  I would highly suggest that you choose something
Summary: I checked in about 30 minutes after check in time and when I went in the bed was unmade with the room obviously not having been made.  I was asked if I wanted to wait in the room for the maid.  I sat on the sidewalk out front instead.  I'm not one for ever writing reviews, but this was ridiculous.
Room tip: There are any number of better places to stay in the Anaheim area.

Summary: Having stayed at other wyndham properties i must say i was disappointed in this hotel. Room was not very clean and was outdated. Breakfast was a very small selection and had to be carried to the room as there is no actual breakfast area.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced. We are hoping that you will provide us with another opportunity to serve your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim. Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Travelodge Stay in Fullerton Near Anaheim
Summary: Until they do a better cleaning in their bathroom and floors, not recommending for families to stay at.  It was noisy from a used car dealership right next door. Also, the some pillow cases had pieces of hair and old washed blood stains on them.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced. We are hoping that you will provide us with another opportunity to serve your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim. Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary: When booking on some sites it stated Daily House Keeping, well this is a lie! They only make the beds every other day(not sure if they even give clean bedding every other day) and they change the towels every other day. They do not clean anything else during your stay. They do at least throw the trash.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced. We are hoping that you will provide us with another opportunity to serve your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim. Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary: I was expecting a more modern room and furniture and more of a variety for breakfast. A nice location, upgraded furniture will give more of an appeal to the property and also a little more than a continental breakfast will also appealing.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to serving your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim - Fullerton, CA. Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary: Don't stay here. They did not initially have the type of room shown on my confirmed reservation (including a desk, that I needed for work).  The room was less than sterile and the property's overall appearance could be significantly cleaned up.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced. We are hoping that you will provide us with another opportunity to serve your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim. Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary: Rooms were dirty. Bring all your own appliances, blow dryer iron, towels. There were fries on the floor by the night stand and hot chettos under the bed. I had to ask for fresh towels because house keeping didnt even go into our rooms. They made our beds once we stayed 6 nights!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced. We are hoping that you will provide us with another opportunity to serve your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim. Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary: Room was small which was not a problem, shower was gross, coffee maker had hairs all over it, carpet had stains on it, and room smelled like smoke, but housekeepers were so nice, beds were comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team and for letting us know where improvement is needed. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to serving your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim - Fullerton, CA. Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary: The room was not  the cleanest but I will stay there another five days next week.  Friendly staff, did not like to have to pay for ice.  Bed was ok.  I will look for a different motel in the area.  Of course it will be a Wyndham
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to serving your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim - Fullerton, CA. Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary: Terrible hotel, I have stayed in many Wyndham hotels. I thought booking this hotel with the Wyndham name we would be staying in a decent hotel, absolutely filthy. Gives Wyndham a bad name, I have never stayed in a dirtier hotel. I put my baby on the ground for 5 minutes to crawl, he was black from dirt. I went to clean him in the bath,the shower was broken. We drove 12 hours to attend a funeral, unable to take a bath prior to going. Manager said they would put us in a "cleaner" room, by cleaner they meant broken liquor bottles all over the floor. They said they would fix our shower, they did not. Absolutely terrible hotel, do not waste your money. Unless you like terrible customer service and dirty rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  We are hoping that you will provide us with another opportunity to serve your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Hotel Management

Summary: Rooms were extremely small. Burn Mark's in the carpet.  House keeping workers had an argument about having to clean rooms cussing as my children were walking by. When we returned to the Room the towels that were switched out had holes and were ripping. When we went up to the housekeeping lady and asked to switch out the towels she rolled her eyes and handed us the towles. We ran out of toilet paper and went to ask, they told us they would bring a roll up to the room.. no body came, 2 hrs later we asked again (same house keeping lady) seemed to be bothered that we asked for the roll 2 hrs later.  I wouldn't consider the location to say they provide breakfast.  You only have a choice of coffee or milk and fruit loops or a muffin.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  We are hoping that you will provide us with another opportunity to serve your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Hotel Management

Summary: There was a very strong chemical smell in our room that immediately gave both of us a headache.  The bathroom was not very clean,  including the tub being dirty, long black hair in the towels,  and a brownish red splatter midway up the outside of the bathroom door that could have been poop or blood. The pillows were too small, more like couch throw pillows than actual bed pillows, and for being close enough to Disneyland, breakfast should be offered well before 8 a.m.,  when the park is usually opening.  Additionally,  the initial advertisement online mentioned a hot tub, yet we were unable to find one on the property.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review for our team. We appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  We are hoping that you will provide us with another opportunity to serve your lodging needs again in the future here at the Travelodge by Wyndham Fullerton Near Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Hotel Management

Summary: The room was a dive  I had no hand soap to wash my hands bed was hard as a rock and I have a back.back the wifi wasn't working at all i started uploading a video around 1230am it was still uploading at 630am I walked out of the hotel at 630 am never again

Room very clean & comfortable Breakfast starts too late 8am & no toast or waffles 2 types of cereal & coffee usually empty Muffins & pastries were yummy but went quick & not replaced  If you want a smoking room ring first before booking as booking online dosn't mean you will get one

I stayed here for 3 nights and I was very happy with my choice.  The room size was good and the beds very comfy.  Close to lots of fun places to go..like Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm.  Will definitely go here again when I visit Anaheim area.

Where do I begin, this is the worst place I’ve ever stayed. It started with a 15 minute wait to get checked in because no one was in the front lobby we waited and waited and rang the bell and no one came until I went outside and found the guy and he said I’ll be there in a minute. Then when we went to the room there were piles of furniture covered with sheets and caution tape in the parking lot. The room was dirty they were burns in the bedspread and carpet there was rust on the refrigerator no hot water rust on the showerhead hair on the walls it was just nasty the whole thing was a very bad experience.  This place look like it was about ready to shut down close for good. Which might not be a bad idea, it certainly wasn’t luxury it certainly wasn’t clean it certainly did not

There's truly nothing to recommend this property.  The bathrooms were small and dated, and the carpets need a good cleaning.  The road noise was all by intolerable.  It's not near anything, and the parking lot was completely full when we arrived, requiring us to park in the street, nearly a block away.  This was a family weekend at Disneyland, but unfortunately for us, we timed our visit with a large convention at the Anaheim Convention Center, which meant all closer options were booked, or  overpriced.  Still, faced with having to drive to the park anyway, there are tons of other, better options.  Wish I'd known that then.

Summary Heading: Good price if you're are trying to save for a disney adventure
Summary: The hotel is the last place you think about, so if you're willing to lower your standards a bit just to save money and enjoy your trip, then this is the place. The hotel room was small, but we only used it to sleep and change, so we were hardly there.

Everything went well except they didn't provide the wake up call we requested and breakfast was VERY minimal. That's no big deal though. It was simple, clean, they were friendly, it's a short drive to Disney which is great for pass holders! I would recommend this hotel for sure!

Do not ever stay at Travelodge Fullerton Anaheim.  I had to go to the front office every morning to ask for coffee or towels.  My son's room was horrible.  He hurt himself on the bed frame, light fixture over the sink fell off and hit him in the head and the light on the wall flickered all the time and would not shut off.  They also didn't have a smoke detector in their room.  I will never stay there again.  I rented three rooms and what a waste.  If this is the type of hotels or motels that are under Wyndham, I may have to revoke my membership.

Summary Heading: Charged $40 deposit, I cleaned  bathroom b4using, non...
Summary: Charged $40 deposit, I cleaned  bathroom b4using, non working WiFi, a bloodstained carpet, coffee and pastry is not breakfast discount for inconvenience was the same price for 2nd day...

When we arrived back at the hotel after spending the evening at the park, there was no parking. The closest street parking was in a nearby residential neighborhood. When we attempted to tell the staff, the office was locked with no one in sight. At least the room was clean because everything else made us uncomfortable

First off, Wyndham made mistake on our initial reservation so we had to make a last minute change. This non-smoking stank of smoke, even causing our clothes to smell. The tub was dirty and the bottom of the tub felt like it would collapse. The shower curtain was dirty and frayed. We saw a cickroach in the bathroom light/fan. Our second day, we came back and we had no towels. The breakfast was essentially non-existent.
Front desk staff are very friendly and welcoming. The room was comfortable. I had a great experience staying here!

First room not made up second room toilet had no handle was wired to work not fixed until the next day. Breakfast Costco sweet rolls fruit loops cereal no coffee. Next morning no water could not take a shower.
Very nice spacious room with great ammenities like free wifi and coffee in room, mini fridge and microwave, cable TV. Friendly staff on site able to fix any issue you may experience.Budget friendly!!

Good localization but terrible employees. They charged me 20 dollars for a employee mistake. and they did't take it back. There was no parking place for the guests, our room key was desconfigurated... etc

Summary Heading: young staff, poor attention to customer needs or experience
Summary: Younger staff this time. They seemed to give poor attention to customer needs or experience. No chair in room, ice machine broken, poor continental breakfast, coffee and cereal only, no milk for cereal...Closed breakfast before 9:30  closing time,. When I brought this to their attention, they had and "oh well too bad" kind of attitude. Room was clean, but not sure if had clean bedding. Have stayed there in past with adult caretakers with no problem.

Assumptions were made and with my 7 year old there it seemed the rep wanted to argue about his assumption. Needless to say in a threatening manner it was mentioned I would NOT be getting my $40 deposit back. Very uncomfortable situation and I’ll never return to that location. Scared my child.   Side note: horrible WiFi and only had to kill one roach smh please fumigate with my contribution of $40.
This facility was very good for me in large measure due to its location.  But also the facility was quite acceptable in terms of the comfort of the bed,and  the completeness of television offerings.

Staff was great. Hotel was extremely clean. Decor was very outdated but serviceable and the bed was comfortable. Only problem (just my personal preference) would like to see coffee available in the morning by 6:30am. I believe this is standard. This hotel makes coffee at 7am.

Summary Heading: Disappointed. Would only recommend if its last resort.
Summary: I have stayed at my Wyndham Hotel Group for the past 11 years and Travelodge Fullerton was disappointing.   Only upside is that it is 10 minutes away from Disneyland and near freeway entrance. Staff was friendly.  We stayed in Room 121  Disappointed by: Reusing of key sleeve. I understand we are trying to be “eco friendly” and recycle things but come on! When a key sleeve is practically dirty and brown don’t give to new customer. (Photo Attached)  Beds Sheets are old, with holes, looks like cigarette burns. (Photo attached) Needs major renovation. Pillows  should no longer be called a pillow as it was flat as a blanket when you laid your head on it.   Tv / Light Location: There is a light fixture right next to the television screen not sure why its there. But its blinding when

We selected the Wyndham Travelodge in Fullerton as it was close to our destination. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The pricing was average for a one night stay. The room was comfortable. We were surprised when they had pastries and coffee in the morning while we were checking out. We would stay here again.
Always great time hotel staff where at there best not ride not at all ride when waking up there felt like waking up at home

My family and I had a wonderful time in California and wit the stay at Travelodge it just stayed that way. I would recommend this Travelodge location to my family and friends as I will be staying there again in the near future. This has been my 3rd stay at the Fullerton Travelodge.

Summary Heading: Bathroom was so tiny that the door almost hit the toilet...
Summary: Bathroom was so tiny that the door almost hit the toilet. The shower was very scetchy and would move when you would move in it. The tub felt like it could buckle at any time.
Hotel didnt want to honor the price we found online. Was disappointed and had no other options since it was labor day weekend. Over priced.

Summary Heading: Worst night every people next to was so loud all. Igor so I...
Summary: Worst night every people next to was so loud all. Igor so I had to leave the hotel and find another I had to be at work at 6:00

Summary Heading: Good stay clean rooms but noisy
Summary: Stayed here cuz my car was having problems. Easy check in, a little pricey but overall no complaints. Would stay here again if I had to.

Very  Small room for two queen beds and the bathroom always gets hot water and it gets cold and came back hot and cold again every moment and the AC every time when you live they turn off and when you camback the room was super hot

Summary Heading: Room smelled of smoke. Wanted non smoking, attendant said...
Summary: Room smelled of smoke. Wanted non smoking, attendant said it was non smoking room. Son got bitten from something on bed spread. NEVER had to pay for ice in any hotel we have stayed at until this stay.

It was a hot day and night.  I was only there at night.  But couldn't sleep, due to a very hot night and bad air conditioning in my room.  I don't think they all had bad air conditioning,   but mine did.  It was a hot, sticky, miserable night.

Summary Heading: My stay was a nice clean an peaceful time,specially the...
Summary: My stay was a nice clean an peaceful time,specially the front desk clerk women  help me how to keep track on the rewards

I don't know what I should enter here that is not covered in the detailed questions that follow.  I don't know what I should enter here that is not covered in the detailed questions that follow.  I don't know what I should enter here that is not covered in the detailed questions that follow.  I don't know what I should enter here that is not covered in the detailed questions that follow.

Summary Heading: Ok in a pinch but not again
Summary: Reserved accesible room almost 3 months in advance but had someone living in their only disabled room. Never was contacted or notified of this had to do my best with average room was very difficult. Nasty long black hairs in bathtub. Could not afford to go to another hotel so made due.

The room was small but my family of four were comfortable. During the day when I wanted to confirm my reservation, no one would answer the phone, I had to call back a couple times and Did not sound happy or warming, rather cold and came off as rude to me. Did not have extra supplies up front for guests. One blanket in room smelled of feet 😷 and both sheets on beds had some tiny brown spots on them???
The hotel room was clean. Handles on the furniture were falling off. On one day we were missing coffee, bath mat, 1 towel. Had to go the next morning to get all the items.

The room wasn't ready. There was nowhere to wait until it was.  The air conditioner was broken.  The window lock was broken.   Did not feel safe. I left and stayed elsewhere.  Old and dirty.  Not worth the money.

This motel had roaches.  Not recommended.  I am a Windham Rewards Member but the guy there said he could not give me credit for the two rooms i rented for four days.  Internet does not work.  Had to use cell phone hotspot.

The location was ok, not great, but ok, but the price was a bit steep for what you get. The room stayed hot most of the night (they're a bit outdated with the unit in the window) room was a little small and everything was pretty basic.
Hotel was easy to find - they have plenty of free parking - breakfast was OK, consisting of pastries, juice and coffee. Plumbing worked fine. Relatively clean.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet easy quick commute to Disneyland
Summary: Good location and good rates. Upgraded rooms, great staff. This has become my first choice when visiting DCA (which is several times annually since I have a annual pass).

Summary Heading: The hotels in a great location close to the freeway as well...
Summary: The hotels in a great location close to the freeway as well as downtown Fullerton and many restaurants and places to go to would definitely recommend

Summary Heading: You sent me to the wrong hotel
Summary: I would not recommend this hotel unless you feel the need to save money. Saving money is one thing but this ??

This facility is old and could stand to be remodeled.  The bed was comfortable and the room was clean.  The shower was designed for vertically-challenged people.  The "continental" breakfast consisted of pre-packaged muffins, yogurt, coffee and juice boxes.
The room was musty as if someone smoked in there and the air conditioner did not work well and was too loud to get a good nights sleep. The staff were very nice and professional though.
A very clean and quite place to stay. Located in a great area that is close to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm. I will stay again.

Summary Heading: One Night stop before Disneyland Trip
Summary: Nice clean room, reasonable accommodations and very close to our desired attraction. Decent amount of restaurants and fast food places around, as well as shopping destinations in case you forgot something

Summary Heading: Not too bad for a motel
Summary: I would rate this location 3 stars, the look of some of the room are nice but it needs improvements in general
Staff was incredibly helpful and went the extra mile to get me a ground level suite since I walk with a cain

I went to this Travelodge near Knotts Berry Farm titally exhausted from travel with no Christmas even celebrateded and jyst wanted to rest.  I thought orobably to extend bevause I was so exhausted.  I had even tripped and fell out of my cab on my back. The guy called me before it was time to check out and was demanding I leave quick because the maid was coming. I decided to leave because he wasnt nice enoughh to give me time to look it up online. He called before time to to check out 5 minutes after .  And then stood there in the doorway of the room next to mine like I was a child that needed to be watched. He cofused me and I left my food . I came back feeling like the maid was at my room. A different guy said to go in the iffuce but I said no I think the maid was in my room.
You get what you pay for. Although, noise at night was a little too loud and the windows felt like they were open even if they were closed.
Location is fair. Rooms need a definite upgrade. Bedding  is old and furniture is run down. Pay for ice was a bit much!
Our stay was very pleasant.  The room was clean and the staff extremely helpful.  Arrived late without a reservation and they give us a room with no problem at all. Very nice folks!

Summary Heading: Definetly not up to Wyndham standards
Summary: As a Wyndham timeshare owner I have valued their standards of quality. Nothing about this motel was up to par. Well, I will grant them the fact that their staff were courteous.  The room smelled of stale cigarette smoke even though it was a non smoking room. the refrigerator didn't keep anything cold even after turning it all of the way up. and the continental breakfast consisted of hostess muffins, bags of chips, bananas and coffee.

This is a simple clean facility, perfect for a place to stop, shower and rest. Nothing fancy or spacious, but we found it very clean, quiet, and accommodating.  The staff was very friendly. There was a complimentary breakfast with prepackaged pastries, yogurt, juice and so on; quick and easy. We really liked having a fridge and microwave in the room.  Can't beat this for the price, especially if you just want to have a comfortable place to sleep at the end of a busy day. Close to freeway and attractions.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Hotel was the cheapest for what I needed and that was about the only good thing about it.  Had to pay $0.25 for ice and that was per bucket, not unlimited.  "Breakfast" was pastries and green bananas.  I will now not be looking for the cheapest hotel anymore.  Also it seemed like this was a hotel where people live at also.

Summary Heading: Was good for a one night visit
Summary: The room was very clean could feel people walking around below and outside on the walk way, but I will stay there again when I have a business meeting in Fullerton It is a older Motel so you have to take that in consideration it was nice.
The room was clean with no issues.  Nothing extraordinary either good or bad.  It was as expected.
have love fun, but turned out it was dirty everything. Never ever come back again. So scared of Travelodge Hotel.
The front desk lady on the night shift was extremely nice. And she was still there in the morning when we were getting our coffee. And she was still very nice and in a great mood. Great coffee also.

Never have we stayed at a hotel that charges for an early check-in, requires a deposit in addition to the room charge & only allows one car per room. We had a really hard time understanding the front desk clerk and felt very uncomfortable with how everything was handled.

The owners were so helpful when I had a problem at check-in, and the Svenhard breakfast danishes they serve (whicn I eat sometimes at home) are wonderful. For a quiet, affordable, and conveniently located hotel in OC, I highly recommend this Travelodge. I will stay here again.

The Air Conditioning units repeatedly broke, would be so loud that we couldn't sleep, or were in such poor condition that they would not work properly (This was one of the hottest weeks with over 100 degree temperatures).  We requested/had to be moved from our rooms multiple times due to this. Had to go our last night there without AC because we had not yet found another hotel to stay in. Other accommodations were sub-par and dated, and staff was completely empathetic to the major AC problems.
The management was friendly. The rooms were clean. Non-smoking room was actual non-smoking room.  Rate was reasonable.

I am handicapped and requested a downstairs room on the reservation. I was not told until I checked in that they have no rooms downstairs with Queen beds. I had to try and get up the stairs to a room in which was on the end of the hotel right overlooking the busy street.   The beds were as hard as rocks.  They had muffins and juice boxes in a cooler but no place to sit for breakfast.

This place is the worst place ever.  It is right on a main street.  On the corner  light.  It was very noisy.  The front desk clerk (ken) is not very helpful (trying to be nice).  I went to ask to be moved to another room.  No was his answer.  Asked for a refund.  No was his answer.  I had already paid.  He would not give me my money back.  It stinks, not safe, their was a big hole in the wall.  It look like rats had made it.  DO NOT BOOK THIS PLACE!!!!

1. Power outlet wouldn't charge. 2  Shower didn't work properly (leaked at spigot).  3. Shower height is about 5' high.  4. Everything was dirty, carpet especially. 5. The second floor walkway was tilted and looked like it was about to fall off.  6. Check in was not a very friendly experience.  7.  Lots of street noise.

Summary Heading: rating my stay at the Travelodge
Summary: The room was clean and had all of the things I needed for a comfortable stay.  Convenient location of stores and restaurants. I would stay there again if given the option.
I stayed 2 nights, the check in was fast. Room was good for what you would expect. The morning breakfast was well stocked. I had no issues or complaints. Good stay.
usually all the Travelodge places we have stayed have full breakfast variety and is equipped with iron and iron board. this one only had bread, coffee and juice. It had no Iron or Iron board.
I am glad it was just for night stay. The room was small, the carpet was dirty.  The beds were small not enough room for two. One of the worst I ever stayed.

Check-in = Rude Lady in the front .. RUDE!! Customer service was HORRIBLE                       Wouldn't accept a CC for deposit only CASH, which wasn't advised before                        hand so we had to leave and come back. 1st room= room key didnt work. wasnt able to enter the room had to go back down and                      get it fixed and instead gave us another room. 2nd room =  the light didnt work and was told NOT to use the tub because it will leak                        downstairs -_- Room was dirty and smelled upon arrival.  Just the worst experience ever.  Had I been able to cancel and get my money back would have left that same day but couldn't so I had to stay the four nights.

Not Wyndham quality at all.......no breakfast area, small compact refrig in office package pastry had to get tokens from office for ice machine....rooms outdated...Not very appealing to the eyes....we made online reservations with no refund policy or would not have chosen to stay here at all...

Summary Heading: i WAS VERY HAPPY WITH THE ROOM AND THE SERVICE
Summary: Myself and my son were very pleased with the accomodations we had at Travelodge . Service was nice , manager was very nice , and perhaps next time when we need to get away , we will choose travelodge
Very small outdated furniture some bad odor in the room. not happy. icancel my next travelodge reservation in burbank

The receptionists were all equally horrible. When asked or called for items they complained or felt the need to explain why items were not given. Hotel was not cleaned very well either. Will not recommend or stay at this location again.
The service was terrific! The manager was very courteous and friendly. I appreciate his advice about how to get a car rental (Enterprise) near the area.

Summary Heading: Ok place to stay for a night
Summary: Ok place to stay for a night. Clean enough. Service was not great. Wouldn't recommend this hotel as more than a place to sleep

The rooms are dirty. Towels aren't clean. The bed sheets are dirty I was itching the entire time. I will never stay at another travel lodge again. It was disgusting. The manager was a complete jetlag until my boyfriend walked up.

Place is nice and clean the only thing was you are able to hear ur neighbors. Thin walls I'm assuming. Other than that it was all good. Complementary breakfast is just snacks like juicy and fruits, muffin, yogurt.

This is the first Travelodge I stayed at (Out of 3) that was actually comfortable in a great location. The only thing, which is a small issue was that they don't have a hot breakfast but they do have snacks and little things to much on. The staff was nice and friendly.

The customer service at the front desk is very poor. They have no regards for the customer. The night manager is also very rude and not attentive to the needs of the customer. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

The hotel was clean and in a good location for the event I was attending. Continental breakfast options could have been a little better but appreciated they offered it at all. Would stay here again.  Internet was a little slow but worked just fine otherwise.
Internet required a password and did not get it. It was too late to call for service. This password should be given when keys are given to the customer.

Summary Heading: I would never stay at that hotel again
Summary: Horrible customer service, no one knew what they were doing there, the man was incredibly rude, the worse hotel stay I have ever had!!!!!!
Need put post or something on website for "No swimming pool/Spa " so we can know it but sadly not have chance hop in spa over the weekend
The room was descent. Housekeeping could maintain the rooms better. I felt as if the room had never been vacuumed. I would stay here again only if the per night rate was reduced.

Summary Heading: wouldn't stay here again. Seemed like a sketchy...
Summary: wouldn't stay here again. Seemed like a sketchy neighborhood. Doors didn't seal all the way. Maids still came in even though the do not disturb sign was on the door.

Room was old and dingy. Bathroom was small and cramped, toilet vey old fashioned and shower head very short. Shower temperature varied form cold to hot. Continental breakfast was terrible. Would not stay there again.

Summary Heading: Room was very clean and slept well, but check out was too...
Summary: Room was very clean and slept well, but check out was too early. Internet password did not work. "Continental" breakfast was juice boxes and yogurt cups.

Always a pleasant staff, helpful and courteous. Usually booked solid so reserve your stay as early as possible. Centrally located to Anaheim and Fullerton spots of entertainment and shopping. Check it out for yourself.

Summary Heading: A place to lay your head
Summary: The hotel was decent.  The night clerk was polite and helpful.  The room was ok.  The bed was hard and the pillows were flat.  There was a fridge and a coffee pot in the room, however, for my room I only received decaf coffee.  I had two rooms and my other room had regular coffee so I don't know what was up with that.  The continental breakfast was fine, I was even offered a bag to take it with me since there is no place to eat it in the lobby.  The rooms were quiet and clean.  I would stay there again.
Not a great location and the front desk was not willing to work for early checkin, in spite of requesting them so many times. They wanted more money for early checkin even for 1 hr.
I reserved a double room with double qn bed and only got a single room with 3 qn beds my 10yr olf had to sleep with my 17yr old daughter.

This hotel offers minimal towards perks, but a lot towards hotel location off Hwy 91 at somewhat value pricing ($78 for 2).  Bulky furniture gets in the way, barely get cool with AC or mini frig, and charging for ice is a negative after driving long distances… bed(s) and restroom are adequate if all you need is a place to flop.
Our room smelled like mildew and my husband was shocked by the microwave because it wasn't grounded. Thank god he didn't have a heart pacer!

We were looking for somewhere close to work and near the freeway. We loved everything about this location. The gentlemen at check in was very accomodating with finding me a downstairs room. The room ktself had all amenities including a king size bed that was very co fortable. Had a great nights sleep. Can't wait to stay again!
Uncomfortable beds, uncomfortable pillows, the A/C sucks! It hits you in one leg and the rest of the room is hot....

Summary Heading: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the room. It...
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the room. It was clean and comfortable! The manager even let us check out a little late, which was awesome because we woke up late

Summary Heading: Not far from Disneyland, but could use some modernization
Summary: We had a room with two double beds and it was quite cramped. One bed was right up against the air conditioning unit. Additionally, the unit didn't have an auto temperature shutoff, so the room froze at night on the low setting but the room got too hot when turned off completely.
property is located in area of the hospital, property is old , very little breakfast ,not much coffee,

Rooms have been remodeled, beds are the utmost comfort. Maids are exceptionally sweet and nice. The couple at the front desk are the nicest people, the only thing is that the ice machine is a quarter but now the have the continetal breakfast. Lovin' every minute of it.

Summary Heading: Yuck! Even the ice was dirty!
Summary: You get what you pay for, but geeeeeeze! This place was hideous! We were looking for a cheap place to stay to celebrate my brother's birthday near downtown Fullerton. This was the only place that didn't mention rats and roaches in the room on the reviews.  The hotel itself is on a dumpy street and the staff is really irritating. We had to wait about 20 minutes to check in because they were having some problems with the register. We finally get to our room, and I go down to get ice and I'm amazed. you have to insert a quarter for 3 ice cubes, and they came out with little black specks in them!!!!!! The fridge in the room kept everything nice and luke warm. We called front desk and 30 min later one of  the rude guys came up and looked at it, he claimed there was nothing wrong with

I've stayed here twice, both times I was looking for a last minute reservation that was fairly nice and not too expensive. Both times I was welcomed and greeted by the people at the front desk; they make my check in easy. The rooms are clean and spacious. My favorite feature was the mini fridge so I can keep my drinks cold. Both times I had checked out around 5am, I rang the night bell and the people working the front desk were at my service and checked me out pretty fast (the fastes compared to other small hotels). The reason why I took off two starts was for SAFETY. Management needs to check up on their tenants because I'm sure something fishy goes on in these rooms. Both times I saw random people weird wandering in and out of rooms at 5am. I noticed a guy carrying his bike

i am a very particular person and require the basic comforts with a clean non-smelling room with  properly functional features from shower/bath to sink , a/c-heater and no unexpected critters -this hotel room was perfect with everything just right- my host at front desk on that day of ck-in honored my reqst for no room service and xtra towels for the days i stayed- i really appreciated that and his respect for my  privacy- thank you.

My family of 2 teen boys and my husband and myself stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland. It was easy to get to, staff was friendly, and we drove in and parked at toy story lot (easier than mickey and friends).  The beds were kinda hard.. but it's a motel... but the room was very clean, and well equipped with a refrigerator and microwave and flat screen TV.   Bathroom had an odd odor that I couldn't place. May have been cleaning product.. it was a small bathroom .. but it was very clean.   There is a 711 within walking distance, and a food store across the street. Very convenient.   Our family was very pleased overall for the price.

Summary Heading: Clean motel not far from Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights while on a road trip. We went during the summer and nearly all the hotels surrounding Disneyland were booked full, and the ones that were not were out of our price range. Travelodge Fullerton provided everything we needed while we were in the area for an inexpensive price. It's right off the freeway, making it a quick drive to Disneyland, Downtown Disney, etc. The room was clean and the staff accommodated our late arrival/check-in. If your expecting the amenities of a 3 or 4-star hotel, you may be disappointed. However, if you're just looking for a place to sleep after a long day in the parks or exploring, this is a great central location. I would recommend staying here!

We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed one and a half days at Disneyland and were so happy we had a parking spot when we arrived back at our room late each evening. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable and the AC worked as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the price.

When I called to add an extra day to my trip I ended up with two reservations and then they deleted one of my days so I had a vacation where I had to leave early because they lost my Saturday night reservation.  The people you talk to are very hard to understand.  Since I ended up with two reservations I could not get back into my room on Thursday after checking in Wednesday and then not spending the night there.  Would not stay again.

The room was clean and they had a good selection of tv programs. The tv was a flat screen LG and there was small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, writing desk, and hair dryer. Overall, very accommodating.
Location is very convenient because the drive from Disneyland Mickey and friends parking structure is within 10 minute drive.

Summary Heading: Super friendly and clean. Asked for a non smoking room and...
Summary: Super friendly and clean. Asked for a non smoking room and this is the first time my room did not have a lingering cigarette smell embedded in the walls. I would definitely stay here again.

I just need a quick place and I didn't want to spend a fortune. The hotels in Anaheim and the surrounding area can really zap your wallet in the summer (Disneyland). This place ofered a room at a very good rate and the rate, in comparison with the other hotels/motels, made me a little skeptical. It was well kept, the owners/staff were amazing, it was right next to the 91 freeway and it was more than worth the money. The only thing I found that wasn't the greatest was the continental breakfast. It was sparce.

I stayed with the Fullerton Travelodge from June 24 to June 28.  I checked out before the 11a checkout time and remembered I left my watch in the room.  I spoke with the the front desk who stated she would have the manager look for the watch.  Of course, the watch was not found and it was early enough that housekeeping had not been in the room to clean.  It's not a matter of the price of the watch but it is a matter of integrity and trust.  I work in federal law enforcement and can say with 100% certainty that I will never stay with another Wyndham Hotel and will inform others of my misfortune.

Everything was pretty good. Cozy room. Friendly atmosphere. Good service. Only two major problems. It was extremely hot in the room. It was cooler outside than inside the room. The A/C was beyond terrible. Not to mention the bathtub... The water was cold hardly no hot water. I wasn't even able to take a bath the water kept draining and the bathtub was kinda dirty.... Other than that the TV was wonderful and so was the comfy bed. Not worth the price. The travelodge on Disneyland drive is much better and has a pool... Go there

My husband and I came into town for the ASU/Fullerton baseball game. It went 14 innings and we ended up getting to the hotel around 2am. The man that greeted us was very friendly. We got into the room and it was great! There was a refrigerator and microwave!! I was happy because when I looked online the hotel didn't say it had either! Huge PLUS! The bed was very comfortable and so were the pillows.  We would most definitely stay here again. Great price and great service.

I only asked three questions for each of the hotels I stayed at on this trip.  Is there high speed internet? Is the pool heated, and is there a hot tub?  The wifi was horribly slow... and hard to connect to.  The pool was not heated... and the hot tub was closed down by the health department.   On the other hand, the rooms were nice, clean... and the tv was modern.  The breakfast was very good, and the owners were pleasant.  ۞♀Wolf♔,’’, ^⊰❂❂⊱^ ,’’,
There's no breakfast at this location as advertised on this site. The room and service was great. Not the best neighborhood, however.

Rarely stay at hotels because of sanitary reasons but this place was clean, affordable and had great customer service. they we're very generous with the amenities, we forgot our toothbrushes and they provided some. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Not the best not the worst
Summary: Lets start with what was good it was clean, it had a microwave and small freezer fridge and small cafepot withe comp coffee and cups as well as blow dryer. Now for the downside there was no pool or hottube the floor towl was durty and the bedspread had stains the tv was small and the frontdesk lady never welcomed use becase she was like ice just cold.
Very basic room though the King-size bed had a fine mattress.  Very little room to maneuver.  Close to the 91-fwy and could hear the noise all night long.  No real negatives.

Summary Heading: Not a Travelodge, more like a motel
Summary: No breakfast and some people received McDonald gift cards while others received nothing.  Rooms are clean but hot water runs in and out so get ready to either take a quick shower or take a cold shower, I've stayed in other Travelodge in the area and this one is below my expectation.  One positive point is they have a good wireless Internet range.

The motel/room was well kept and clean, very poor quality accommodations, such as towels, sheets, pillows, TP and  so on. It was a good deal because it was so cheap. If I had to pay full price I probably would have chosen a different hotel.
It was ok. Relatively clean. Cheap. Could have used more pillows and towels and maybe a channel guide.

The room was okay not much room for two peoole to walk around!  Parking was not very addequite, had to park my truck on backside of hotel due to our side only had 10 parking spots. Other than that close to frwy and lotsvof stores, easy to find,

Updated rooms, well sort of. A/c was left on for a cool room and housekeeping turned it off, no water pressure and no comp. Breakfast for what you paid for. Not really worth $80 plus a night. Room was overpacked with furniture. The bed was very hard and difficult to sleep on. What they call towels to dry off after a shower was almost like two rags at a mechanic shop. The free wifi well use it sparingly its good for only 1 computer or smart phone and the signal is very weak. I just wouldnt stay here again because you dont get what you pay for.

Horible for price you pay. When searching on line thru Wyndham stated spa and continental breakfast. No spa or breakfast served. The from desk when check in would not even mentioned about their breakfast not being served. I had to ask and been given 2 5$ cards to McDonalds. Joke. I am very disappointed. Price was very high for this type of place. Would not ever book again !

For the price, you don't expect a 5-star experience. But, we got dirty, stained towels, and upon uncovering the bed, a *used* dirty Q-Tip was discovered. Clearly, the linens weren't cleaned or changed out. Disgusting.
It's ok very nice and clean I'll recommend it just for sleep for a couples of night  I like the bed it's clean n firm
Friendly staff, clean rooms, quiet at night.  I very much so enjoyed my stay!  Would recommend to friends!

The hotel is kind of old, rooms, AC´s, and furniture in general. At the time of my visit they did not had Breakfast service, in exchange we were given McDonalds prepaid cards.  The hotel location is really good. Low price and 5 miles away from Disney or shopping malls.  For me it was a convenient deal.

Summary Heading: Convenient location near shops and restaurants. Room and...
Summary: Convenient location near shops and restaurants. Room and bed were big enough for family of four. Staff was pleasant and helpful.

The bath room was really small. Your arm rest was the TP holder. It is located next to an apartment complex and when we checked in and parked a individual was standing next the apartment  area and was watching who was driving in. Everything was ok but just a little creepy. Also complex is located net to a used car lot, so  in the morning people walking around.

Summary Heading: Emergency hotel, Grateful for clean and nice bed. Late...
Summary: Emergency hotel, Grateful for clean and nice bed. Late late check in  . Pot smokers in room next door. :(

Summary Heading: Not quite worth the price, staff didnt explain the...
Summary: Not quite worth the price, staff didnt explain the continental breakfast so we missed it, but room was very clean
Staff was friendly like always rooms very clean love the cable and flat screens. I will be back

Summary Heading: Close enough to Disney but a little farther
Summary: I found this property around St. Patrick's weekend. I went for a visit to Disney and was going to stay w/ my son but he was sick for a week and I didn't want to catch anything. This property is one freeway exit from Disney but close enough to my son's Fullerton address. The place was clean, had all the basics, had continental breakfast, friendly staff. I asked for extra pillows and got them. There's an ice machine and vending machine. The room had a microwave and fridge. As I said, had all the basics, even a hair dryer. I'm definitely coming back. Good value and close enough to Disney, but far enough from the hussle and bussle.

When I booked this hotel I was under the assumption we I booked at Travelodge/Anaheim on Ball Road.  When we checked in at  Travelodge/Anaheim it was discovered I was at the wrong place.  The web site showed me Anaheim and changed to Fullerton.  The room was too small and the bathroom was from a travel trailer (too small).  The hotel was located next door to a use care dealership.  We're going to use another hotel firm on are next trip in April and trips in the future.  Plus, I was charged for one night at Travelodge/Anaheim after the mistake was discovered.

Let me say the staff were friendly and helpful.  The rooms were generally clean except the tops of the showers had years of dust and grime on them.  You could hear everything outside.  There was light coming in from around the door.  The ice machine costs a quarter and had floating substances in it once the ice melted we could see it.  The bed pillows were bricks of foam.  This was the worst wyndham property I have ever stayed in and over the last year and I have stayed in a lot of them.

When I checked in, the proprietor wrote my credit card number on the back of the check-in card (and the expiration date).  When I questioned him about this  unusual practice, he said he had to enter my number manually into his computer.  This was after he ran the card through the cc machine. Never seen this technique before.   Room was noisy.  There was dried blood on my sheets. (not mine)
It was bad did not get my breakfast the key wouldn't work the parking was  Horrible. I wouldn't stay here nomore outdated TV they have cable but no guide to check what's on

Summary Heading: The rooms had a weird smell, the first keys did not work so...
Summary: The rooms had a weird smell, the first keys did not work so we had to get a second set.  A bug was killed on one of the walls and they did not bother to clean it off.  I will not stay at that Travelodge again.

Paper thin towles and ragged. Blood stained matress. You dont get the same service or accomadation in all of the rooms. some have coffee makers , long time tenate rooms customers are treated like dirt!! 3 years!!!. Paying customer no hand out or favors asked. Management put the party kids on top of working people. Roaches in the light fixtures and very noisy a/c units!!!

Clean, quiet and comfortable. The management could be more helpful without demanding things. Near Disney an Anaheim Convention Center. You need multi passwords for each device. Would stay again. Reasonable priced. Not fancy but nice.

i stayed here for two nights while my house was getting fumigated. the place is clean, decently priced, and the staff is very nice.  i would stay here again and i will definitely recommend this place to my family/friends that come into town to visit.

Summary Heading: Not very nice staff to me I use to much toilet paper when I asked for another roll had to buy my own
Summary: alright beds crummy staff.do not ask for more tp. Bring ur own

My family and I came to California to go to Disneyland.  We did not want to spend alot on hotel rooms but of course wanted a comfortable and clean place to stay.  Fullerton Plaza Innn was perfect.  The front desk staff were so friendly and ever so helpful.  Their prices were affordable.  We will be staying there again nexty year!
